STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 20, 2025
Kara Mularz
Ogemaw/Roscommon County DHHS
444 E HOUGHTON AVE,
WEST BRANCH, MI, 48661-1130
RE: License#: CP650201338
Dear Kara Mularz:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 08/13/2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact WOC area manager, Shay Mavis, at (269) 243-2725.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment did not require a corrective action plan
review. Ongoing practices to maintain compliance were reviewed as well as key
performance indicators. Also reviewed were challenges associated with staffing
and youth changes in placement.

Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not identify/indicate any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: One home needed an additional smoke detector.
Resolution: A smoke detector was provided and installed. Compliance was
confirmed by an onsite visit and picture documentation. Approved by DCWL
4/21/2025.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
08/20/2025
_____________________________________
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 20, 2025
Shannon (Shay) Mavis Date
